header.title: HTML Reporter
header.description: Interactive reports with cost tracking and AI decisions. Beautiful, interactive test reports that make debugging easy.

whatAreReports.title: üéØ What are HTML Reports?
whatAreReports.description: After running tests, Endorphin AI creates interactive web reports that provide comprehensive insights into your test execution.

quickStart.title: üöÄ Quick Start
quickStart.description: Generate your first HTML report in 3 simple steps

thatsIt.title: ‚ú® That's it!
thatsIt.description: Your report opens in the browser automatically.

features.title: üìã Report Features
features.description: Comprehensive insights into your test execution

dashboard.title: Dashboard View
dashboard.description: When you open a report, you'll see:
dashboard.summaryCards: Summary Cards: Total tests, passes, failures
dashboard.testList: Test List: All your test results

searchTests.title: Search Tests
searchTests.description: Type in the search box to find tests instantly - by ID, name, or any content

filterStatus.title: Filter by Status
filterStatus.description: Click tabs to filter: All, Passed, Failed tests

viewScreenshots.title: View Screenshots
viewScreenshots.description: Click any screenshot to see full-size, zoom, and navigate between steps

testDetails.title: Test Details
testDetails.description: Click "View Details" on any test to see:
items: Step-by-step execution
Timing for each step
Screenshots at each step
Error messages (if failed)

advancedFeatures.title: Advanced Features
advancedFeatures.description: Enhanced reporting with AI insights and cost tracking

costTracking.title: Cost & Token Tracking
costTracking.description: Each test shows detailed AI usage information:
items: Total cost - How much the test cost to run
Token usage - Input and output tokens consumed
AI model used - Which OpenAI model processed the test
Cost per step - Breakdown of expenses by test step
Session totals - Aggregate costs for the entire test run

aiDecisionHistory.title: AI Decision History
aiDecisionHistory.description: See exactly how the AI analyzed and executed your test:
items: Agent thinking - What the AI was considering at each step
Decision process - Why the AI chose specific actions
Tool selection - Which browser tools were used and why
Error recovery - How the AI handled and fixed issues
Context awareness - How previous steps influenced decisions

stepInformation.title: Detailed Step Information
items: Action taken - What the AI did (click, fill, verify, etc.)
Target elements - Which page elements were interacted with
Tool arguments - Parameters passed to automation tools
Execution time - How long each step took
Token cost - AI processing cost for that specific step
Before/after screenshots - Visual proof of what happened

fileOrganization.title: üìÅ Where Reports are Saved
fileOrganization.structure:
test-results/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ reports/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ report-2025-01-04.html    # Today's report
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ screenshots/               # Images for the report
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/                    # Styles and scripts
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ HEALTH-001_2025-01-04/         # Raw test data

debugFailed.title: Debug Failed Tests
steps: Filter by "Failed" to focus on problems
Click "View Details" on a failed test
Look for the red error step
Review AI thinking - See what the AI was considering when it failed
Check tool selection - Verify the AI used the right automation tools

monitorCosts.title: Monitor Test Costs
steps: Track spending - See total cost for each test run
Optimize expensive tests - Find tests that use too many tokens
Compare costs - See which tests are most/least expensive
Budget planning - Use cost data for project planning

shareReports.title: Share Reports
shareReports.description: Reports are self-contained HTML files. You can:

exportData.title: Export Data
exportData.description: Press Ctrl+E to export test data as JSON for:
